meanings.definition: The state of being young or youthful.
meanings.sent1: Her juvenility made her full of energy and joy.
meanings.sent2: In his juvenility, he loved to play outside all day.
meanings.sent3: The cat's juvenility showed when it chased its own tail.
meanings.sent4: Juvenility is like a fresh breeze on a hot day.
meanings.sent5: The garden bloomed with the juvenility of spring flowers.

meanings.definition: The period of life before reaching adulthood.
meanings.sent1: During his juvenility, he learned many new things.
meanings.sent2: Her juvenility was filled with laughter and games.
meanings.sent3: In juvenility, every day feels like an adventure.
meanings.sent4: Juvenility is a bridge between childhood and adulthood.
meanings.sent5: The memories of juvenility are often the sweetest.

meanings.sent1: His juvenility showed when he made a silly mistake.
meanings.sent2: She blamed her juvenility for the error in her work.
meanings.sent3: Juvenility can sometimes lead to funny moments.
meanings.sent4: In the world of business, juvenility can be a big hurdle.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's patience helped the students overcome their juvenility.
